alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 8:11PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Butler, northeastern Monroe and central Conecuh Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles east of Beatrice to 12 miles north of Evergreen to 6 miles southeast of Peterman. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Evergreen, Georgiana and I65 And US 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
